title: Biden openly acknowledges 7th grandchild, the daughter of son Hunter and an Arkansas woman
description: President Joe Biden on Friday for the first time publicly acknowledged his seventh grandchild, a four-year-old girl fathered by his son Hunter with an Arkansas woman, Lunden Roberts, in 2018

title: Backup driver in 1st death by a fully autonomous car pleads guilty to endangerment
description: The backup Uber driver involved in the first death involving a fully autonomous vehicle has pleaded guilty to endangerment

title: Trump says he'll still run if convicted and sentenced on documents charges
description: Former President Trump said Friday that he'll continue to run for president even if convicted and sentenced on criminal charges brought by the special counsel.

title: Bay Area man fatally stabbed woman and posted video of it on Facebook, police say
description: Authorities say a man allegedly stabbed a woman to death in the San Francisco Bay Area and then posted a video of the slaying to Facebook

title: Carlee Russell charged with making false statements to police in 'hoax' disappearance
description: Carlee Russell, who told police she was kidnapped after she went missing, was arrested and charged with two misdemeanors for making false statements to police.

title: $940 million Mega Millions jackpot up for grabs
description: The Mega Millions jackpot surged to $940 million for Friday night's drawing. There have been 28 consecutive drawings without jackpot winners.

title: Senate passage of defense policy bills tees up fall fight with the House
description: The Senate passed its version of the bill Thursday night, 86-11, setting up a showdown with the House, which passed a bill that included several controversial measures.

title: Trader Joe's recalls 10K cases of broccoli cheddar soup that 'may contain insects'
description: Trader Joe's initiated a recall on its refrigerated broccoli cheddar soup that was distributed in seven states.

title: 'We were in the air': Family recounts surviving tornado that tore mobile home apart
description: Tornadoes in the United States are disproportionately killing more people in mobile or manufactured homes, especially in the South

title: American Airlines tentative contract deal with pilots. Southwest still negotiating
description: American Airlines and the union for its pilots have agreed on a new contract, which will now go to a ratification vote

title: WATCH:  Waters near Cape Cod are one of world’s largest shark hotspots, study shows
description: In the study published in the Marine Ecology Progress Series, researchers counted about 800 great white sharks visiting the region from 2015 to 2018, finding the number increased over the years.

title: Updated Trump indictment reveals new charges in classified docs case
description: The Department of Justice's superseding indictment against the former president and two of his staffers revealed alleged incidents.

title: Woman dies, 6 hospitalized after boat hits breakwall, capsizes in Lake Michigan
description: Authorities say a woman died and six other people were hospitalized after a boat struck a Chicago breakwall and capsized in Lake Michigan

title: Biden to sign 'historic' executive order on how military handles sexual assault cases
description: U.S. President Joe Biden will sign a "historic" executive order on Friday that will change how the military handles sexual assault cases, according to the White House.

title: Inflation gauge closely tracked by the Fed falls to lowest level in more than 2 years
description: A measure of consumer prices that is closely monitored by the Federal Reserve fell last month to its lowest level since March 2021, the latest sign that inflation in the United States is steadily cooling from its once-painful highs

title: Arizona medical examiner's office at 106% capacity, brings in refrigeration units
description: The medical examiner's office in Arizona's Maricopa County is over capacity and has had to bring in refrigeration units due to a spike in deaths this month.

title: Scott criticizes DeSantis over his support for Florida's slavery curriculum
description: U_S_ Sen_ Tim Scott is criticizing fellow Republican presidential candidate and Florida Gov_ Ron DeSantis for supporting standards requiring teachers to instruct middle school students that slaves developed skills that “could be applied for their perso...

title: Ford recalls 870K F-150 pickups in US because parking brakes can turn on unexpectedly
description: Ford is recalling more than 870,000 F-150 pickup trucks in the U.S. because the electric parking brakes can turn on unexpectedly

title: Who's in charge of Nashville airport? US and state officials disagree under new law
description: Nashville International Airport has quietly faced an identity crisis for weeks under a new state law, with no clear agreement about who is in charge

title: Exclusion zone set up around Greek military base after wildfires trigger explosions
description: Authorities are maintaining an exclusion zone around an air force base in central Greece where wildfires triggering powerful explosions at an ammunition depot

title: WATCH:  3 whales breach surface simultaneously
description: The photographer tells ABC News he recently returned from a humanitarian trip to Ukraine — and it was the first time his three daughters were all together in 10 years.

title: Interest rates are at a 22-year high. Here’s what that means for your finances.
description: The Federal Reserve's historic rate hikes carry major implications for people's finances, experts said.

title: 'I just didn't want to die': Trucker attacked by Ohio police dog breaks his silence
description: Truck driver Jadarrious Rose spoke out Thursday about a July 4 incident in which he was attacked by an Ohio police dog while surrendering with his hands up.

title: Niger’s military announces ousting of President Bazoum in apparent coup
description: Access to the presidency has been sealed off, “all institutions” suspended, and Niger’s borders closed

title: No clarity about who's in charge in Niger, days after soldiers ousted the president
description: Two days after mutinous soldiers ousted Niger’s democratically elected president, it was still unclear who was running the country and what mediation efforts were underway

title: Russia says a Ukrainian drone was shot down outside Moscow
description: Russia’s defense ministry says a Ukrainian drone was shot down early Friday outside Moscow, the third drone strike or attempt on the capital region this month

title: Nearly 200 million people in US are under heat, flood advisories
description: Nearly 200 million people in the United States are under either a heat advisory or flood warning of some kind, as high temperatures and severe storms are to continue blazing and battering the nation

title: WATCH:  Suspected bank robber falls through ceiling and into recycling bin
description: Body camera footage captures the moment a suspected bank robber falls through a ceiling panel and into a recycling bin — with police officers waiting for him.

title: U.S. Women's World Cup tie vs. Netherlands draws combined audience of 7.93 million
description: The United States’ 1-1 draw against the Netherlands in the Women’s World Cup drew 7.93 million viewers, making it the largest combined English- and Spanish-language audience for a group stage match involving the American women

title: Crane collapse linked to company and operator with history of safety violations
description: As authorities continue to investigate a crane collapse that rained thousands of pounds of steel debris onto a busy Manhattan street, the owner and operator of the failed crane are facing scrutiny over past safety failures

title: The Eagles say Randy Meisner, a founding member of the band, has died
description: Randy Meisner, a founding member of the Eagles who added high harmonies to such favorites as “Take It Easy” and “The Best of My Love” and sang and co-wrote the hit “Take It to the Limit,” has died at 77
